title: Sequences and Functions - ratios and differences

content.question: ​The second term of a sequence is <math alttext="6"><semantics><mn>6</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and the fourth term is <math alttext="24"><semantics><mn>24</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Of the following, which statement is true?

choices.label: ​If the sequence is geometric, the first term could be <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​If the sequence is arithmetic, the third term could be <math alttext="12"><semantics><mn>12</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​If the sequence is geometric, the fifth term could be <math alttext="48"><semantics><mn>48</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​If the sequence is arithmetic, the sixth term could be <math alttext="48"><semantics><mn>48</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: ​If the sequence is geometric, the fifth term could be <math alttext="48"><semantics><mn>48</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
